intro: Parodia rigidispina, commonly known as the rigid spines cactus, is a species of cactus native to the arid regions of Argentina. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are often ribbed and covered in white, woolly hair. The plant produces yellow flowers during the warmer months, typically in spring or early summer. Its spines are stiff and straight, giving it a distinctive appearance. Parodia rigidispina is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water.
